zone.line: peace. tha now that my innocence is ackow
ledged by you, sweet lady, and your cousin."
Thus the poor sufferer cr tried
to comfort others and herself. She indeed
gained the resignation she wished for
but I the true murderer w felt
the never dying worm alive and I was which
allowed no hope or consolation. Eliza
beth also wept and was unhappy but
hers‸ also was also the misery of innocence
like a cloud that that passes over the
fair moon which for a while
hides but cannot disturb destroy its brightness
but misery & desp anguish and
despair had penetr penetrated into
the core of my heart- I bore a hell
within me that nothing could diminish extinguish.
We staid several hours with Justine
and with it was with great difficulty
that Elizabeth tore herself away
"I wish" cried she that I were to die
with you- I cannot live in this world
of misery." Justine assumed an air
of Cheerfullness while she with diffi
culty repressed the bitter tears- "Farewell
sweet lady, dearest Elizabeth may heaven
in its bounty bless and preserve you
